From Wiktionary, the free dictionary

Catalan

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Borrowed from Latin ūnīre.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): (Central, Balearic) [uˈni]
  • IPA(key): (Valencia) [uˈniɾ]
  • Audio (Barcelona):(file)
  • Homophone: uní

Verb

[edit]

unir (first-person singular present uneixo, first-person singular preterite uní, past participle unit)

  1. (transitive) to unite, join
  2. (transitive) to combine
  3. (transitive) to link together
  4. (intransitive) to be united, to be joined
  5. (pronominal) to join (a group), to become a participant or member of [with a]

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of unir (third conjugation, with -eix-)
infinitive unir
gerund unint
past participle masculine feminine
singular unit unida
plural units unides
person singular plural
first second third first second third
indicative jo tu ell/ella
vostè 		nosaltres
nós 		vosaltres
vós 		ells/elles
vostès
present uneixo uneixes uneix unim uniu uneixen
imperfect unia unies unia uníem uníeu unien
future uniré uniràs unirà unirem unireu uniran
preterite uní unires uní unírem uníreu uniren
conditional uniria uniries uniria uniríem uniríeu unirien
subjunctive jo tu ell/ella
vostè 		nosaltres
nós 		vosaltres
vós 		ells/elles
vostès
present uneixi uneixis uneixi unim uniu uneixin
imperfect unís unissis unís uníssim uníssiu unissin
imperative — tu vostè nosaltres vosaltres
vós 		vostès
affirmative — uneix uneixi unim uniu uneixin
negative (no) — no uneixis no uneixi no unim no uniu no uneixin

Derived terms

[edit]
  • unir-se

Related terms

[edit]
  • un

Further reading

[edit]
  • “unir” in Diccionari català-valencià-balear, Antoni Maria Alcover and Francesc de Borja Moll, 1962.
  • “unir” in Diccionari normatiu valencià, Acadèmia Valenciana de la Llengua.
  • “unir”, in Gran Diccionari de la Llengua Catalana, Grup Enciclopèdia Catalana, 2025
  • “unir”, in Diccionari de la llengua catalana [Dictionary of the Catalan Language] (in Catalan), second edition, Institute of Catalan Studies [Catalan: Institut d'Estudis Catalans], April 2007

French

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Inherited from Old French unir, borrowed from Latin ūnīre.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /y.niʁ/
  • Rhymes: -iʁ
  • Audio (Paris):(file)
  • Audio (France (Lyon)):(file)
  • Audio (France (Somain)):(file)

Verb

[edit]

unir

  1. (transitive) to unite, join
  2. (transitive) to combine

Conjugation

[edit]

This is a regular verb of the second conjugation, like finir, choisir, and most other verbs with infinitives ending in -ir. One salient feature of this conjugation is the repeated appearance of the infix -iss-.

1 The French gerund is usable only with the preposition en.
2 In less formal writing or speech, these tenses may be found to have been replaced in the following way:
past historic → present perfect
past anterior → pluperfect
imperfect subjunctive → present subjunctive
pluperfect subjunctive → past subjunctive

(Christopher Kendris [1995], Master the Basics: French, pp. 77, 78, 79, 81).

Antonyms

[edit]
  • séparer

Derived terms

[edit]
  • Émirats arabes unis
  • États-Unis d'Amérique
  • prolétaires de tous les pays, unissez-vous

Related terms

[edit]
  • un
  • uni
  • union
  • unique

Further reading

[edit]
  • “unir”, in Trésor de la langue française informatisé [Digitized Treasury of the French Language], 2012.

Ladin

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From Latin ūnīre.

Verb

[edit]

unir

  1. to unite

Conjugation

[edit]
  • Ladin conjugation varies from one region to another. Hence, the following conjugation should be considered as typical, not as exhaustive.
Conjugation of unir (fourth conjugation)
infinitive unir, unì
auxiliary verb avei gerund unian
past participle unì
person singular plural
first second third first second third
indicative ie tu el / ela nos vos ei / eles
present une, unesce unes, unesces un, unesc union unieis un, unesc
imperfect unive unives univa univan univais univa
future uniré uniras unirà uniron unireis unirà
subjunctive che ie che tu che el / ela che nos che vos che ei / eles
present une, unesce unes, unesces une, unesce union unieis une, unesce
imperfect unisse unisses unissa unissan unissais unissa
imperative – tu – nos vos –
— un, unesc — union unide —

Occitan

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From Latin ūnīre. Attested from the 14th century.[1]

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • Audio (Béarn):(file)

Verb

[edit]

unir

  1. to unite

Conjugation

[edit]

Portuguese

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Learned borrowing from Latin ūnīre (“to unite”), from ūnus (“one”), from Old Latin oinos, from Proto-Indo-European *óynos (“one; single”).

Pronunciation

[edit]
 
  • (Brazil) IPA(key): /uˈni(ʁ)/ [uˈni(h)]
  • (Brazil) IPA(key): /uˈni(ʁ)/ [uˈni(h)]
    • (São Paulo) IPA(key): /uˈni(ɾ)/
    • (Rio de Janeiro) IPA(key): /uˈni(ʁ)/ [uˈni(χ)]
    • (Southern Brazil) IPA(key): /uˈni(ɻ)/
 
  • (Portugal) IPA(key): /uˈniɾ/
  • (Portugal) IPA(key): /uˈniɾ/
    • (Southern Portugal) IPA(key): /uˈni.ɾi/

  • Homophone: uni (Brazil)
  • Hyphenation: u‧nir

Verb

[edit]

unir (first-person singular present uno, first-person singular preterite uni, past participle unido)

  1. (transitive) to bind; to connect
    Synonyms: colar, conectar, grudar, jungir, juntar, ligar, prender, vincular
    Antonyms: desconectar, desprender, desvincular, separar
  2. (ambitransitive) to unite (come or bring together as one)
    Synonyms: aliar, casar, conectar, juntar, vincular
    Antonyms: desvincular, separar

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of unir (See Appendix:Portuguese verbs)

First-person
(eu) 		Second-person
(tu) 		Third-person
(ele / ela / você) 		First-person

Future unirei unirás unirá uniremos unireis unirão
Conditional uniria unirias uniria uniríamos uniríeis uniriam

Imperfect unisse unisses unisse uníssemos unísseis unissem

Related terms

[edit]
  • união
  • unido

Further reading

[edit]

  • “unir”, in Dicionário inFormal (in Portuguese), 2006–2025

  • “unir”, in Dicionário infopédia da Lingua Portuguesa (in Portuguese), Porto: Porto Editora, 2003–2025
  • “unir”, in Michaelis Dicionário Brasileiro da Língua Portuguesa (in Portuguese), São Paulo: Editora Melhoramentos, 2015–2025
  • “unir”, in Dicionário Priberam da Língua Portuguesa (in Portuguese), Lisbon: Priberam, 2008–2025

Spanish

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Borrowed from Latin ūnīre.[1]

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /uˈniɾ/ [uˈniɾ]
  • Audio (Colombia):(file)
  • Rhymes: -iɾ
  • Syllabification: u‧nir

Verb

[edit]

unir (first-person singular present uno, first-person singular preterite uní, past participle unido)

  1. (transitive or reflexive) to unite, join
    ¡Únete al sindicato!
    Join up with the union!
    • 2020 September 10, Alexis Benveniste, “El listado Fortune 500 ahora tiene un número récord de mujeres CEO: apenas 39”, in CNN en Español‎[3]:
      Fraser se une a otras 38 mujeres en la lista de CEOs de Fortune 500, conformada en su mayoría por blancos y hombres.
      (please add an English translation of this quotation)
  2. (transitive) to merge, conflate

[edit]

These forms are generated automatically and may not actually be used. Pronoun usage varies by region.

Venetan

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From Latin ūnīre. Compare Italian unire.

Verb

[edit]

unir

  1. (transitive) to unite, join (together)

Conjugation

[edit]

* Venetan conjugation varies from one region to another. Hence, the following conjugation should be considered as typical, not as exhaustive.

Conjugation of unir (third conjugation)
infinitive unir
auxiliary verb aver gerund unéndo
past participle unito, unìo
person singular plural
first second third first second third
indicative mi ti eło / eła noialtri / noialtre voialtri / voialtre łuri / łore
present uniso (te) unisi (el/ła) unise unimo unì (i/łe) unise
imperfect unìa (te) univi (el/ła) unìa unìvimo univi (i/łe) unìa
future unirò (te) unirè (el/ła) unirà unirémo unirè (i/łe) unirà
conditional unirìa (te) unirisi (el/ła) unirìa unirìsimo unirisi (i/łe) unirìa
subjunctive che mi che ti che eło / eła che noialtri / noialtre che voialtri / voialtre che łuri / łore
present unisa (te) unisi (el/ła) unisa unimo unì (i/łe) unisa
imperfect unise (te) unisi (el/ła) unise unisimo unisi (i/łe) unise
imperative — ti eło / eła noialtri / noialtre voialtri / voialtre łuri / łore
— (te) unisi (el/ła) unisa unimo unì (i/łe) unisa

Welsh

[edit]

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • (North Wales) IPA(key): /ˈɨ̞nɪr/
  • (South Wales) IPA(key): /ˈiːnɪr/, /ˈɪnɪr/

Verb

[edit]

unir

  1. (literary) impersonal present/future of uno
